Question_1.Context: The study investigated the antioxidant abilities of different extracts from Cinnamomum camphora chemotypes.
Question_1.Question: Which solvent exhibited the strongest antioxidant ability among the 4 extracts?
Question_1.Source: MeOH extracts exhibited the strongest antioxidant ability among the 4 extracts.

Question_2.Context: The study analyzed the terpenoid composition in different extracts from Cinnamomum camphora chemotypes.
Question_2.Question: Which terpenoid showed the strongest scavenging activity against DPPH free radicals?
Question_2.Source: Ocimene showed the strongest scavenging activity against DPPH free radicals.

Question_3.Context: The study evaluated the in vivo antioxidant activities of ocimene and longifolene.
Question_3.Question: Which compound showed the strongest effect on protecting algal cells against oxidative stress?
Question_3.Source: At the same concentration, longifolene showed the strongest effect on protecting the algal cells against oxidative stress.

Question_4.Context: The study compared the antioxidant abilities of different terpenoids in various reaction media.
Question_4.Question: Which reaction medium showed the highest scavenging activity against ABTS free radicals?
Question_4.Source: All terpenoids exhibited the optimum scavenging activity in MeOH among the 4 reaction media.

Question_5.Context: The study identified two strong antioxidant terpenoids from Cinnamomum camphora extracts.
Question_5.Question: Which terpenoid exhibited the strongest scavenging activity against ABTS free radicals?
Question_5.Source: For ABTS free radical, longifolene showed the strongest scavenging activity.

Question_6.Context: The study analyzed the antioxidant abilities of the main terpenoids in different solvents.
Question_6.Question: Which terpenoid showed the strongest scavenging activity against DPPH free radicals in MeOH?
Question_6.Source: In MeOH reaction medium, ocimene showed the strongest scavenging activity against DPPH free radical.

Question_7.Context: The study evaluated the effects of ocimene and longifolene on the growth of Chlamydomonas reinhardtii under H2O2 stress.
Question_7.Question: Which compound improved the tolerance of algal cells to H2O2 stress?
Question_7.Source: The pretreatments with ocimene and longifolene improved the tolerance to the H2O2 stress.

Question_8.Context: The study measured the ROS levels in Chlamydomonas reinhardtii under H2O2 stress.
Question_8.Question: Which compound effectively lowered the ROS levels in algal cells?
Question_8.Source: The pretreatments with ocimene and longifolene remarkably lowered the ROS levels.

Question_9.Context: The study analyzed the antioxidant enzyme activities and TBARS content in the in vivo antioxidant assay.
Question_9.Question: Which compound gradually decreased the activities of antioxidant enzymes in C. reinhardtii under H2O2 stress?
Question_9.Source: The activities of the three antioxidant enzymes significantly improved after 24-h H2O2 treatment, but gradually decreased with raising the concentration of ocimene.

Question_10.Context: The study measured the TBARS content in C. reinhardtii under H2O2 stress.
Question_10.Question: Which compound gradually decreased the TBARS content in algal cells?
Question_10.Source: The TBARS content gradually declined with raising the concentration of ocimene.
